Segment

SOME DESCRIPTION HERE…

class dtpr.particles.segment.Segment(iseg, ev=None, wh=None, sc=None, st=None, phi=None, eta=None, nHits_phi=None, nHits_z=None, t0_phi=None)[source]
__init__(iseg, ev=None, wh=None, sc=None, st=None, phi=None, eta=None, nHits_phi=None, nHits_z=None, t0_phi=None)[source]

Initialize a Segment instance.

A Segment can be initialized either by providing the root event entry (ev) or by passing each parameter individually.

Parameters:

  • iseg (int) – The index of the segment.

  • ev – The root event object containing event data.

  • wh (int, optional) – The wheel number.

  • sc (int, optional) – The sector number.

  • st (int, optional) – The station number.

  • phi (float, optional) – The global phi position.

  • eta (float, optional) – The global eta position.

  • nHits_phi (int, optional) – The number of phi hits.

  • nHits_z (int, optional) – The number of z hits.

  • t0_phi (float, optional) – The phi time offset.

__str__(indentLevel=0)[source]

Generate a string representation of the Segment instance.

Parameters:

indentLevel (int) – The indentation level for the summary.

Returns:

The segment summary.

Return type:

str

match_offline_to_AM(tp, max_dPhi=0.1)[source]

Match the segment to a trigger primitive based on dPhi.

Parameters:

  • tp – The trigger primitive to match.

  • max_dPhi (float) – The maximum dPhi for matching.
